p: Such behavior has been observed in layered manganese oxides [ 12] and perovskite-type materials [ 51]. The sudden increment in the conductivity, above 10 Hz for Mn8 material ( Figure 7), most likely is due to the high quantity of Mn 3+ ( Table 1) compared to Mn4. However, Mn4 had the highest conductivity ( Figure 7) because of its smaller crystal size and higher surface area ( Table 1). The conductivity values obtained at 10 Hz were 4.1250 × 10 −6 and 1.6870 × 10 −4 Ω −1cm −1 for Mn4 at 298 and 423 K, respectively. For Mn8, the conductivity values at this frequency were 3.7074 × 10 −7 (298 K) and 3.9866 × 10 −5 Ω −1cm −1 (423 K).
